keyword: calories in ham and split pea soup
title: Calories in Ham and Split Pea Soup
meta_description: Learn calories in ham and split pea soup per cup serving, including protein, carbs, fiber, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for your recipe.
h1: Calories in Ham and Split Pea Soup
assumptions: Standard serving (1 cup or ~245 g); includes split peas, diced ham, carrots, onions, and broth; cooked without added oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, ham type, vegetable amounts, and cooking method. Check labels for packaged soups.

quick_answer.text: One cup of ham and split pea soup provides ~190 kcal, 12 g protein, and 10 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 oz extra diced ham per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of ham and split pea soup?
What's the protein content in ham and split pea soup?
faqs.a: About 12 g protein per cup, mainly from peas and ham.

faqs.q: Is ham and split pea soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg sodium per cup due to broth and ham; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: How much fiber in split pea soup with ham?
faqs.a: Roughly 10 g dietary fiber per cup from the peas.

faqs.q: Does homemade vs. canned change calories in ham and split pea soup?
faqs.a: Homemade can vary; canned often has 180-220 kcal per cup depending on brand.
